WorkItem.Summary: InvalidOperationException - Can't bind to readonly properties

Comments.Message:
Yeah, got the same problem. The workaround is to set IsReadOnly="true" on column.
Note that setting IsReadOnly on whole grid doesn't work (maybe it works only for auto-generated columns?), you should force each column to be read-only.

And setting RowHeadersWidth="0" also solves problem with lining up cells to column headers. 
Also there's an issue with horizontal scrolling, but I have no solution for this.
It should default to read-only when the binding is set explicitly to OneWay, but that is not implemented yet. I confirm that the workaround is to set IsReadOnly="true", works here.

Known Issues are listed here, http://www.codeplex.com/wpf/Wiki/View.aspx?title=Tips%20%26%20Tricks.

By default, the DataGrid sets all the bindings for each column to TwoWay and Explicit behind the scenes (even if you explicitly set them to something different).  This is an implementation detail for row/cell editing to work correctly.  By setting IsReadOnly to true, the bindings will not set the Column to TwoWay.

This has been fixed in our internal builds and an update with the fix will be released in the near future.  Thanks for reporting this issue!

Samantha
Note: you can also get this error even with IsReadOnly="True" if you do a bone-headed copy/paste and try to use a string property on a DataGridCheckBoxColumn.
